Answer: When greed, hatred, delusion, and pride become rampant, they are definitely able to give rise to coarse bodily and verbal karma.
Even if this view of the five aggregates as a real self becomes rampant, it is still unable to give rise to coarse bodily and verbal karma.
Therefore it is indeterminate. Furthermore, this view of the aggregates as real self does not cause sentient beings to fall into evil destinies.
Therefore it is indeterminate.
Question: There are also unwholesome afflictions that do not cause one to fall into evil destinies.
They should be indeterminate.
Answer: If the unwholesome afflictions are rampant, they will definitely cause sentient beings to fall into evil destinies.
Even if this view of the aggregates as real self is rampant, it will never cause one to fall into evil destinies.
Therefore it is indeterminate. Furthermore, this view cannot bring about undesirable results.
Therefore it is indeterminate.

Therefore, they are indeterminate.
